entry.title: Pretty Boy, With His Eyes All Over Me
entry.summary:
Author: august_underground

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,981Chapters: 3/3Kudos: 39

Summary: Eddie reached into his gym bag and pulled out his towel then headed towards the showers. He was just turning the corner into the shower block when he saw Buck. He stopped dead in his tracks, unsure if what he was seeing was actually happening or not. A few feet in front of him, Buck was stood under the spray of the shower head, with his head tilted back and his eyes closed. One hand was bracing the wall, the other was wrapped around his dick. It was impressive - lengthy and thick, the kind that would make your knees weak. Eddie quickly backed away, not sure what to do next, his heart was hammering in his chest. Maybe he should go back into the gym, do some stretches or something and give Buck some privacy to finish off. He peered round the corner, as if to confirm what he had seen, but he couldn’t force himself to look away again.   Or   Eddie gets some pointers from Buck at the gym, and catches him jerking off.

entry.title: i know you by your heart and i will call you by your name
entry.summary:
Author: hispolestar

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,863Chapters: 2/11Kudos: 41

Summary: ‘Yes,’ she said and something in Eddie broke at that. Or maybe, it slotted together, like puzzle pieces. ‘I think your name would be Edmundo.’‘But- Abuelo?’‘I think you’d carry on his name well,’ she said, cupping his cheek, pushing the short strands of Eddie’s hair out of his face. ‘It means defender.’‘Defender?’‘Ah, you protect people- look after them, take care of them.’Eddie felt his chest constrict, the breaths he sucked in short and shaking.‘Sweetheart,’ Abuela said, her warm hand on Eddie’s cheek, pushing away the tears falling down his face. ‘Do you want to be Edmundo?’Eddie stared up at her, the name settling around him like a well-worn, well-loved blanket.‘Yes,’ he whispered, watching the smile stretch over his abuela’s face.‘Then you will,’ she said, kissing his forehead. ----- Eddie Diaz and the mortifying ordeal of being known and knowing yourself. A season eight rewrite.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 245,378Chapters: 40/?Kudos: 20

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: The Price of Power
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 200,267Chapters: 34/?Kudos: 19

Summary: Athena Carter and Bobby Nash couldn’t be more different. She’s the disciplined “good girl” with her future mapped out, while he’s the dangerous bad boy with one foot in college and the other in the streets. When their worlds start to collide, what begins as a bitter rivalry quickly sparks into something deeper neither of them can ignore. But falling for Bobby means stepping into a world Athena never imagined, one ruled by loyalty and violence. That tested everything she thought she knew about herself. As sparks turn to fire, Athena must decide if love is worth the risk of losing everything.

entry.title: Afraid of Losing you, and I get Rageful
entry.summary:
Author: kidkasora (Pdeter_Pdarker)

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,678Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 46

Summary: There's an insistent tapping on Buck's face, and Buck's eyes drift open back up towards- "Eddie," he says, maybe slurring through his name. It doesn't feel right, as if the words are buffering somewhere between his brain and mouth.  "Eyes on me," Eddie says, except it splits somewhere down the middle.  He has a determined look on his face, the one he wears when he's trying to make sense of a bad call, mouth set and ticked down at the corner. Buck knows that look as surely as he knows how to breathe, the same way his heart knows how to beat. Eddie is gravity, the pull at the center of Buck's world, and even now, when Buck can't find his footing, he can't help but be drawn toward him.  Behind Eddie's eyes, Buck sees fear.  - On the way to a routine call, the 118 engine is involved in a major lateral impact collision. It's confronting for Buck and Eddie, in more ways than one.

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,055Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 34

Summary: He wants to ask: What do you see when you look at me like that? Is this why you're finally able to make eye contact with me? Cause I look the way you want me to? When Buck goes back to looking the way he usually does, and Eddie realizes Buck can't be what he wants. Not forever, not organically, not naturally. A deception. A con-man.   OR: buck is a shapeshifter, morphing into whatever shape the person in front of him most desires. of course eddie doesn't see the real buck, of course a version of buck eddie could ever want would be anything but the real him... right?

entry.title: On the Record
entry.summary:
Author: ScribblesAfterDark

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,507Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 44

Summary: Time seemed to stretch, the world narrowing into a pinpoint. There she was. Shock hit him first. She looked different. Hair scraped back in a messy bun, face pale and tired, dark circles bruising her eyes.…it all triggered memories he had tried so hard to lock away. The fight, the betrayal, the night she’d outed him…he hadn’t even let himself think about her for two years. And now, here she was, holding a baby cradled in her arms. Eddie’s breath caught. His hands slackened at his sides. The air felt thick, heavy, impossible to move through. He could barely process the sight of her, the sound of her voice, the soft whimper of the child. “Shannon?” His voice came out rough. “What…what are you doing here?” Her eyes met his, tired and full of something that looked a lot like guilt. “Hey, Eddie,” she said softly. “We need to talk.” Or, Eddie Díaz finally has everything under control…his career, his relationship…but when his past shows up on his doorstep holding a baby and a thousand unanswered questions. Between the tabloids, the team, and Buck’s new life at the 118, holding it all together might be Eddie’s toughest game yet.

Summary: They spend the whole morning making calls. Death is busy for the living.“Eddito,” his Tia said softly after a while. “Have you told your Buck? He would want to know.”He hadn’t. ORHis Abuela passes. Eddie reckons with God, religion, and coming back to life.

entry.title: why do i fear becoming a river. (which mountain gave me such shame.)
entry.summary:
Author: downintheflames

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,206Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 132

Summary: “Fuck it,” Eddie mumbled before unlocking the phone again and opening his text thread with Buck. They hadn’t texted since Buck asked him if he wanted a scone or a danish from their favorite coffee shop before their last shift. Eddie sighed and pressed the corner of the phone against his forehead. He didn’t want to ask for help. He could spend another hour circling around the city. But he didn’t want to. He wanted this awful horrible day to be done. He wanted to hold his child and pretend for a little bit that everything was still whole. He sighed again before pressing call and pressing the phone to his ear. ———————— Eddie finally asks for what he needs in the aftermath of the sudden loss of his Abuela. Buck finally stops running from his grief. And then Eddie’s parents show up.
